externalDocs.description: Find out more about my website

post.description: Validate Address

422.description: Unexpected error in API call. See HTTP response body for details.

get.description: Get a collection of containers filtering by isActive, warehouse ids, warehouse external ids.

parameters.name: isActive
parameters.description: Returns containers that are active or not. Valid options are 1 or 0.

parameters.name: warehouseIds
parameters.description: Returns all containers that exist in the provided warehouse. Single warehouse's id or comma separated list of warehouse ids.

parameters.name: warehouseExternalIds
parameters.description: Returns all containers that exist in the provided warehouse. Single warehouse's external id or comma separated list of warehouse external ids.

get.description: Get a container by container's id or external id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The container's id or external id.

put.description: Modify a container based on its containers's id or external id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The containers's id or external id.

get.description: Get an itemized list of orders.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Expand order data in the response, instead of accessing directly via a URL (comma separated list).
Valid values are `holds`, `items` , `returns` and `trackings`, `splitOrders`, `pieces` or simply `all`.
See resources `Holds`, `Items`, `Returns`, `Trackings`, `Split Orders` and `Pieces` for information on the data model returned by this parameter.

parameters.name: commerceName
parameters.description: Filter by commerceName (comma separated list)

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: Filter by transactionId (comma separated list)

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Filter by orderId (comma separated list)

parameters.name: orderNo
parameters.description: Filter by orderNo (comma separated list)

parameters.name: referrer
parameters.description: Filter by referer (comma separated list)

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: Filter by externalId (comma separated list)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by status (comma separated list of: `processed`, `canceled`, `completed`, `delivered`, `returned`, `submitted`, `held`, `tracked`)

parameters.name: holdType
parameters.description: Filter by order hold type and status = `held` (comma separated list)

parameters.name: holdTypeNot
parameters.description: Filter by order hold type is not and status = `held` (comma separated list)

parameters.name: excludeInProgressHolds
parameters.description: Filter on status = held ignoring holds less than 60 seconds old (can be combined with holdType or holdTypeNot)

parameters.name: updatedAfter
parameters.description: Only show resources updated after this date (ISO 8601 format, ex: "2014-05-30T13:08:29-07:00")

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: Filter by purchaseOrderId (comma separated list)

parameters.name: vendorId
parameters.description: Filter by vendorId (comma separated list)

parameters.name: vendorExternalId
parameters.description: Filter by vendorExternalId (comma separated list)

parameters.name: warehouseId
parameters.description: Filter by warehouseId (comma separated list)

parameters.name: warehouseExternalId
parameters.description: Filter by warehouseExternalId (comma separated list)

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Filter by order created after this date (ISO 8601 format, ex: "2014-05-30T13:08:29-07:00")

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Filter by order created before this date (ISO 8601 format, ex: "2014-05-30T13:08:29-07:00")

parameters.name: processedAfter
parameters.description: Filter by order processed after this date (ISO 8601 format, ex: "2014-05-30T13:08:29-07:00")

parameters.name: processedBefore
parameters.description: Filter by order processed before this date (ISO 8601 format, ex: "2014-05-30T13:08:29-07:00")

parameters.name: completedAfter
parameters.description: Filter by order completed after this date (ISO 8601 format, ex: "2014-05-30T13:08:29-07:00")

parameters.name: completedBefore
parameters.description: Filter by order completed before this date (ISO 8601 format, ex: "2014-05-30T13:08:29-07:00")

parameters.name: shipwireAnywhere
parameters.description: Filter Shipwire Anywhere warehouse orders: `0` = Exclude Shipwire Anywhere, `1` = Include Only Shipwire Anywhere

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort by field(s) (comma separated list)

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: Sort direction: `ASC` or `DESC` (comma separated list)

post.description: Create a new order.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Expand order data in the response, instead of accessing directly via a URL (comma separated list).
Valid values are `holds`, `items` , `returns` and `trackings`, `splitOrders`, `pieces` or simply `all`.
See resources `Holds`, `Items`, `Returns`, `Trackings`, `Split Orders` and `Pieces` for information on the data model returned by this parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The order's ID.

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: The order's external ID (must be prefixed with "E").

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Expand order data in the response, instead of providing URIs to the data.
Valid values are `holds`, `items` , `returns` and `trackings`, `splitOrders`, `pieces` or simply `all`.
See resources `Holds`, `Items`, `Returns`, `Trackings`, `Split Orders` and `Pieces` for information on the data model returned by this parameter.

See resources `Holds`, `Items`, `Returns`, `Trackings`, `Split Orders` and `Pieces` for information on the data model returned by this parameter.

get.description: Get Job status by Job ID
get.summary: Get Generate Labels Job status and PDF download URL

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Job ID returned when the POST request was made

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: To retrieve successfully generated labels use query parameter `?accept=pdf` or use header `Content-Type: application/pdf`

post.description:
Asynchronously generate labels for multiple orders. The Job will return a combined PDF download URL. Job status can be retrieved via polling or webhook subscription.
API will return HTTP 422 if one of the following conditions are true:
+ Order IDs are invalid
+ Orders are on hold
+ Orders' status is not `processed` or `submitted`
+ Orders' warehouse is not Shipwire Anywhere none-routing only

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Job ID returned when the POST request was made

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: To retrieve successfully generated labels use query parameter `?accept=pdf` or use header `Content-Type: application/pdf`

examples.text/plain:
+ Body
            See: GET response

    + Schema
            See: GET schema

Asynchronously generate packing lists for multiple orders. The Job will return a combined PDF download URL. Job status can be retrieved via polling or webhook subscription.
API will return HTTP 422 if order IDs are invalid

parameters.description: To retrieve successfully generated labels use query parameter `?accept=pdf` or use header `Content-Type: application/pdf`

get.description: Get an itemized list of products.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Expand specific product data in the response -comma separated list.
Valid values are: `all`, `alternateNames`, `alternativeDescriptions`, `masterCase`, `enqueuedDimensions`, `flags`, `dimensions`, `technicalData`, `innerPack`, `pallet`, `values`, `kitContent`, `inclusionRules`, and `virtualKitContent`.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Filter products by matching their "description" property.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: Filter products by matching their "sku" property.

parameters.name: storageConfiguration
parameters.description:
Filter products by matching their "storageConfiguration" property.
Valid values are: `INDIVIDUAL_ITEM`, `INNER_PACK`, `MASTER_CASE`, `PALLET`, `KIT`.

parameters.name: classification
parameters.description:
Filter products by their classification.
Valid values are `baseProduct`, `kit`, `virtualKit`, `marketingInsert`.

parameters.name: includeArchived
parameters.description:
Filter products by their archived status.
Valid values are: `onlyArchived`, `includeArchived`, `excludeArchived`.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Filter products by their status -comma separated list.
Valid values are `notinuse`, `instock`, `outofstock`.

parameters.name: flow
parameters.description:
Filter products by their current step in the flow.
Valid values are `manage`, `kit`, `virtualKit`, `order`, `receiving`, and `quote`.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Filter products by their ID -comma separated list.

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: Filters products by their externalId -comma seperated list

parameters.name: vendorId
parameters.description: Filters products by vendorId -comma seperated list

parameters.name: vendorExternalId
parameters.description: Filters products by vendorEXternalId -comma seperated list

parameters.name: skus
parameters.description: Filter products by their SKU -comma separated list.

x-unitTests.x-testDescription: Get an itemized list of products.

examples.text/plain: See the `getlist products` response for each classification.

request.body: /*** You can modify multiple Products in one PUT request. To do so, list all Product resources inside a JSON array, declare the classification, and send that in the PUT body.* See each classification endpoint for details.** [*    {*        classification:kit,*        (product resource)*        ...*    },*    {*        classification:baseProduct,*        (product resource)*        ...*    },*    {*        ...*    },*    ...* ]** Where "product resource" is any resource that is individually defined under:* POST /api/v3/product (base product)* POST /api/v3/products (marketing insert)* POST /api/v3/products (kit)* POST /api/v3/products (virtual kit)*/See the `Create products` request.

x-unitTests.x-testDescription: Create new products of any classification.

get.description: Get information about a product.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The products's ID.

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: The product's external ID (must be prefixed with "E").

examples.text/plain:
/**
* You can get one Product at a time through GET request with id/externalId.
* GET /api/v3/products/id (base product's id/externalId)
* GET /api/v3/products/id (marketing insert's id/externalId)
* GET /api/v3/products/id (kit's id/externalId)
* GET /api/v3/products/id (virtual kit's id/externalId)
*/
See the `GETLIST products` response for each classification

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The products's ID.

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: The product's external ID (must be prefixed with "E").

examples.text/plain: See the `GETLIST products` response for each classification.

post.description: Indicates that the listed products will not longer be used.

get.description: Get an itemized list of purchase orders.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Expand purchase order data in the response, instead of accessing directly via a URL (comma separated list).
Valid values are `holds`, `items` , and `trackings`, or simply `all`.
See resources `Holds`, `Items`, and `Trackings` for information on the data model returned by this parameter.

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: Filter by transaction Id (comma separated list)

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: Filter by purchase order Id (comma separated list)

parameters.name: orderNo
parameters.description: Filter by order number (comma separated list)

parameters.name: referrer
parameters.description: Filter by referer (comma separated list)

parameters.name: updatedAfter
parameters.description: Only show resources updated after this date (ISO 8601 format, ex: "2014-05-30T13: 08: 29-07: 00")

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: Filter by externalId (comma separated list)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by status (comma separated list of: `canceled`, `needsApproval`, `onHold`, `pending`, `inProgress`, `partiallyCompleted`, `completed`)

post.description: Create a new purchase order.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Expand purchase order data in the response, instead of accessing directly via a URL (comma separated list).
Valid values are `holds`, `items`, and `trackings`, or simply `all`.
See resources `Holds` (not implemented), `Items`, and `Trackings` for information on the data model returned by this parameter.

post.description: Generate a real-time shipping quote.

Generate a real-time shipping quote and provide more shipping options.
Rate 3.1 is a transitional version while we explore what we would like
to see in a v4 API. The request structure is mostly unchanged, with just
the additonal "returnAllRates" option. The response structure provides
the same information as V3 Rate, but it more succinctly groups shipping
methods per rated shipment with a map indicating which methods are
recommended.

get.description: Get Job status by Job ID

post.description:
Asynchronously generate return labels for multiple orders. The Job will return a combined PDF download URL. Job status can be retrieved via polling or webhook subscription.
API will return HTTP 422 if order IDs (or external order IDs) are invalid

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Job ID returned when the POST request was made

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: To retrieve successfully generated labels use query parameter `?accept=pdf` or use header `Content-Type: application/pdf`

examples.text/plain:
+ Body
            See: GET response

    + Schema
            See: GET schema

get.description: Get stock information for your products.

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: Product ID or external ID

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: Filters by SKU, comma-separated list can be specified

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: Filters by product ID (Shipwire platform), comma-separated list can be specified

parameters.name: productExternalId
parameters.description: Filters by product ID (Client platform), comma-separated list can be specified

parameters.name: warehouseId
parameters.description: Filters by warehouse ID (Shipwire platform), comma-separated list can be specified

parameters.name: warehouseExternalId
parameters.description: Filters by warehouse ID (Client platform), comma-separated list can be specified

parameters.name: warehouseRegion
parameters.description: Filters by warehouse Region, comma-separated list can be specified

parameters.name: warehouseArea
parameters.description: Filters by warehouse Area (continents and countries), comma-separated list can be specified

parameters.name: channelName
parameters.description: Sets channelName for the request

parameters.name: includeEmpty
parameters.description: If set to '1' then empty resources will be displayed as well

parameters.name: vendorId
parameters.description: Vendor ID list (comma-separated)

parameters.name: vendorExternalId
parameters.description: Vendor external ID list (comma-separated)

parameters.name: disableAutoBreakLots
parameters.description: Disable Auto Break Lots

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Valid values: IncludingHigherLevelQuantitiesWithLots (default if account is setup to break lots), IncludingHigherLevelQuantitiesWithoutLots, NotIncludingHigherLevelQuantitiesWithLots (default if account is not setup to break lots), NotIncludingHigherLevelQuantitiesWithoutLots

parameters.name: includeEmptyShipwireAnywhere
parameters.description: Include Empty Shipwire Anywhere

post.description: Adjust inventory levels. Only applicable to Shipwire Anywhere warehouses.

get.description: Get a collection of vendors filtering by vendor ids, external ids, vendor names, vendor status.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Vendor's id, supports comma separated list

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: Vendor's external id, supports comma separated list

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Vendor's name, supports comma separated list

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Vendor's status. Valid status values are `active`, `pending`, and `inactive`

x-unitTests.x-testDescription: Get a collection of vendors filtering by vendor ids, external ids, vendor names, vendor status.

post.description: Create a new vendor

get.description: Get a vendor by vendor's id or external id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The vendor's id or external id.

put.description: Modify a vendor based on its vendor's id or external id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The vendor's id or external id.

post.description:
Indicates that the vendor will not longer be used. If the vendor is not associated with any orders, products, or warehouses
the vendor will be deleted. Otherwise the vendor will have its status set to "inactive".

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The vendor's id or external id.

404.description: Unexpected error in API call. See HTTP response body for details.

422.description: Unexpected error in API call. See HTTP response body for details.

application/json.message: Cannot delete: Vendor is associated with products, warehouses, and orders. Vendor status set to 'inactive'

get.description: Get a warehouse by id or external id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The warehouse id or external id.

put.description: Modify a warehouse based on its id or external id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The warehouse's id or external id.

post.description:
Indicates that the warehouse will not longer be used. If the warehouse is not associated with any active vendors or orders
the warehouse will be deleted. Otherwise the warehouse will have its "isActive" property set to false.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Warehouse id or external id.

404.description: Unexpected error in API call. See HTTP response body for details.

422.description: Unexpected error in API call. See HTTP response body for details.

application/json.message: Cannot delete: Warehouse is associated with vendors and orders. Warehouse set to inactive
